result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger D Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

STAYED
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Costs waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week. Obtain high school diploma or equivalent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Defendant must complete 10 hrs CSW per week when not employed or in school.

Defendant Roger D Shields in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Defendant Roger D Shields in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
14CF306 is set for SEH. Parties have received PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. In 14CF713, upon plea to charge, the State recommends CFTS.
In 14CF306, the State recommends probation and strongly opposes expungement. The State asks for 6 mos RCJ to be stayed in 14CF306 and in 14CF317, the State asks for CFTS from 5/22 to present.
Defense is asking for expungement but agrees with probation and the CFTS recommendation. Deft addresses the Court.

P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Expungement is not authorized by the Court. The Court feels it goes against the basis of the statute.
In 14CF306 - Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES/STAYED - 2 yrs probation
     14CF317 - RCJ=CFTS
                        DNA costs, costs

Conditions:
10 hrs CSW if not emp/school = FT
6 mos RCJ/CFTS - STAYED
obey all rules and regs
costs waived
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent
FT emp/school = FT
Must get HS diploma or at a minimum, GED

FAW/vote

If revoked, deft IS eligible for CIP and ERP
filed

It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting with atty.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 05-15-2014 - DEFENDANT MAY TO GO THE RACINE PUBLIC LIBRARY MONDAY, WEDNESDAY, AND FRIDAY FROM 12:30 PM T 2:30 PM, AS LONG AS NO OTHER JUVENILES ARE PRESENT, FOR SCHOLASTIC INSTRUCTION. ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN

AMENDED 05-22-2014 - No contact with JC, dob 11-15/99, Gkarr Piggee and TT, DOB 10/20/1998. No weapons.

BTC: Modify Bond on 14CF306 to $1000 cash bond-same conditions

Defendant Roger D Shields in court with attorney Wendy S Paul.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for Jennifer Tanck-Adams for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The State requests that the deft's bond be modified to $5000.00 cash to include a prohibition of no firearms. The State is also asking the Court to prohibit contact with the persons put on the record and mentioned in the motion. Defense does not object to the modification of bond prohibiting firearms or contact with the persons named in the motion. Ms. Paul isn't sure the information is reliable and there hasn't been information provided to defense that charges may be forthcoming.

BTC: Bond modification raising the amount of bail is denied. There is not enough information for the Court to consider. Bond to be modified to prohibit possession of weapons and no contact with JC, dob 11-15/99, Gkarr Piggee and TT, DOB 10/20/1998. No weapons.
ZCI
